intro: Dimerandra carnosiflora, commonly known as the red-stemmed dimerandra, is a striking South African plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive red stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has pinnate leaves with serrated edges, and its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Dimerandra carnosiflora is typically found in rocky outcrops and fynbos vegetation, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
